file_name: virtuososurgicalinc_20191227_1-a_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_11933379_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_license agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
4.6
Records: The Company shall make and retain, for a period of three (3) years following the period of each report required by
Paragraph 4.4, true and accurate records, files and books of account containing all the data reasonably required for the full
computation and verification of sales and other information required in Paragraph 4.4. Such books and records shall be in
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles consistently applied. The Company shall permit the inspection and
copying of such records, files and books of account by JHU or its agents during regular business hours upon ten (10) business
days’ written notice to the Company. Such inspection shall not be made more than once each calendar year. All costs of such
inspection and copying shall be paid by JHU, provided that if any such inspection shall reveal that an error has been made in the
amount equal to five percent (5%) or more of such payment, such costs shall be borne by the Company.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.14
Records: The Company shall make and retain, for a period of three (3) years following the period of each report required by
Paragraph 4.4, true and accurate records, files and books of account containing all the data reasonably required for the full
computation and verification of sales and other information required in Paragraph 4.4. Such books and records shall be in
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles consistently applied. The Company shall permit the inspection and
copying of such records, files and books of account by JHU or its agents during regular business hours upon ten (10) business
days’ written notice to the Company. Such inspection shall not be made more than once each calendar year. All costs of such
inspection and copying shall be paid by JHU, provided that if any such inspection shall reveal that an error has been made in the
amount equal to five percent (5%) or more of such payment, such costs shall be borne by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the record-keeping and audit clause from 'Payments, Royalty and Reporting' (Section 4) to 'Miscellaneous' (Section 9) reduces its prominence and discoverability. Financial audit rights are generally expected to be located within financial sections of a contract. Relocating this detail could make it less likely for the licensee to be aware of their responsibilities, and increase ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text:
9.8
Product Liability: Prior to first commercial sale of any LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) as the case may be in
any particular country, Company shall establish and maintain, in each country in which Company shall sell LICENSED
PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S), product liability or other appropriate insurance coverage appropriate to the risks
involved in marketing LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and/or LICENSED SERVICE(S) and will annually present evidence to JHU that
such coverage is being maintained. Upon JHU’s request, Company will furnish JHU with a Certificate of Insurance of each
product liability insurance policy obtained. JHU shall be listed as an additional insured in Company’s said insurance policies. If
such Product Liability insurance is underwritten on a ‘claims made’ basis, Company agrees that any change in underwriters
during the term of this Agreement will require the purchase of ‘prior acts’ coverage to ensure that coverage will be continuous
throughout the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.2
Product Liability: Prior to first commercial sale of any LICENSED PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S) as the case may be in
any particular country, Company shall establish and maintain, in each country in which Company shall sell LICENSED
PRODUCT(S) or LICENSED SERVICE(S), product liability or other appropriate insurance coverage appropriate to the risks
involved in marketing LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and/or LICENSED SERVICE(S) and will annually present evidence to JHU that
such coverage is being maintained. Upon JHU’s request, Company will furnish JHU with a Certificate of Insurance of each
product liability insurance policy obtained. JHU shall be listed as an additional insured in Company’s said insurance policies. If
such Product Liability insurance is underwritten on a ‘claims made’ basis, Company agrees that any change in underwriters
during the term of this Agreement will require the purchase of ‘prior acts’ coverage to ensure that coverage will be continuous
throughout the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the product liability insurance requirement to the 'Termination by Company' section obscures its importance. This section focuses on when the contract ends, not on ongoing operational requirements. This makes it harder for the licensor to monitor compliance and increases the risk of the licensee overlooking the essential insurance obligation.

perturbation.explanation: Moving the payment information from Section 4 'Payments, Royalty and Reporting' to Section 8 'Notices' is a structural flaw. Payment information should be easily accessible when dealing with payment terms and not hidden within the general communication section.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Clarity and Transparency
